wikiData.title: Stone v. Graham
wikiData.FullName: Sydell Stone, et al. v. James B. Graham, Superintendent of Public Instruction of Kentucky
wikiData.ParallelCitations: 101 S. Ct. 192; 66 [[Lawyers' Edition|L. Ed. 2d]] 199; 1980 [[LexisNexis|U.S. LEXIS]] 2; 49 U.S.L.W. 3369
wikiData.Holding: A Kentucky statute requiring the posting of a copy of the Ten Commandments, purchased with private contributions, on the wall of each public classroom in the State is unconstitutional because it lacks a secular legislative purpose.
